fields.description:
Shift key is working in the previous version of Source Tree for selecting the some range of lines in the diff panel. In the new version it is not working. The only way to select multiple line is using the mouse only.
All the people generally uses this feature as it is common across the  windows applications.
Please bring back this powerful option.

The new look is also not good.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Shift key not working for selecting a range of lines

fields.description:
If you select 'resolve conflicts' > 'resolve using mine' > the dialogue box incorrectly states 'resolve these files using *their *state'.  The message should be changed to read 'resolve these files using *my* state'.

See screenshot for more details.
fields.summary: One side resolve conflict message incorrectly states 'their'.

fields.description:
- select commits from different branches
- try to open an external diff for any file

expected: external diff opened
actual: the menu is grayed

Works ok on mac. Worked previously on Windows (not sure but remember using it).

Off-topic: guys, what the hell's going on with Windows version? It's getting worse.
fields.summary: Cannot view external diff across different branches

fields.description: The diff viewer was stuck on a single file. I tried switching tabs and coming back, but it wouldn't change when I viewed another file. After restarting the app and coming back in I was able to see individual file diffs as I selected them again. Not sure how this happened in the first place.
fields.summary: Diff does not change when different files are selected

fields.description: I really liked in the previous versions when I selected several commit lines with the mouse or using the SHIFT or CTRL key to do granular commits. This new Source Tree update gives many issues on doing that. If you could please fix that, it would be great, because I don't like to spend a lot of time doing commits. Like even if I just try to stage/unstage one line, it complains (see image attached). It says version 1.8.2.0 doesn't exist but in my about SourceTree that is the version it says it is.
fields.summary: Selecting several lines to stage when committing doesn't work now for SourceTree using Git... it worked great in the previous version
crash when trying to create a pull request from a feature branch

fields.description: When trying to pull from my repo, I am getting the error message that there are unstaged changes. When I try and discard these changes, SourceTree returns "Completed successfully" but the changes remain in the Working Copy.
fields.summary: Can't discard unstaged changes

fields.description:
Can you implement a diff feature which will identify the changes word by word or character by character.

Gitlab Web Interface seems to be able to do this. Would be great if we can have this in SourceTree too.

There have been a few topics on this over the years, but all from about 3 years ago.
Can we have an update on this feature?

Related:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/161107/word-by-word-diff-for-sourcetree
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/241069/intraline-diffs-with-sourcetree
fields.summary: Word-by-word diff on SourceTree, like Gitlab's Web UI

fields.description:
Pictures attached.  
1. Previous versions before this UI update remembered that i'm using current branch during restarts.  Now it always defaults to all branches
2. Previous verisions before this ui update remembered the branch column width.  However this opens to a default during restarts.
fields.summary: Source tree doesn't remember window settings in 1.8.2.x

fields.description: Picture is attached.  Pulling causes error messages regarding temp files when there is a update to the current branch in the remote server.
fields.summary: Pulling causes error dialog to pop up in a Hg repo

fields.description: If you try to create a pull request from the branch which was pushed to the remote, the app will crash.
fields.summary: Unable to create pull request after branch was pushed to the remote

fields.description: It's very uncomfortable to use new shortcut Crl+Shist+Plus to stage selected files: you have to use both hands for it, leaving your mouse. In '2012' version I was able to use 'space' shortcut for such thing that is perfect for such purpose.
fields.summary: Add (stage) file shortcut

fields.description: It seems not possible to make SourceTree show the local directory of the open repository. It would be very useful to have this information always shown somewhere in the GUI, preferably on the top on a long line so it doesn't get truncated.
fields.summary: Show the repository full path

fields.description:
I noticed that after I upgraded SourceTree from 1.6.x to 1.8.23, its appearance and operations change a lot, and now when I click "命令行模式", or "Terminal" in English, on the toolbar, it calls "$msysGit_Root/Git Bash.vbs" to create "%TEMP%/Git Bash.lnk" with given `WorkingDirectory`, and then execute this lnk file to run a shell.

But, this will break SourceTree, if only I delete/rename "Git Bash.vbs" to another - it reported a crash and then exited every time I tested.

Another reason I create this issue is that I hate the way `Git Bash.vbs` executes bash, and what I want is just like a custom action in SourceTree: run a custom executable file with given arguments which may be generated using a few variables like `"$FILE"`.
fields.summary: allow users to use custom bash.exe instead of "Git Bash.vbs" when opening a shell

fields.description:
In the "File Status" view, I usually click on the "Unstaged FIles" check-box to select the entire list in one shot. In previous version it was working smoothly, now, to see it happen, I need to switch to "Log / History" and go back (Ctrl+2/Ctrl+1 in rapid sequence).

The app seems doing some operations because the rotating wait icon is shown in the "Staged files" portion of the screen. No reaction past 1 minute. As soon as I ctrl+2/ctrl+1 the view gets updated properly
fields.summary: Clicking on "Unstaged Files" hangs the app

fields.description:
When I open a submodule repo by double clicking on it, sourceTree opens a new tab showing the related repo. That' fine.

When that tab is closed, it would be great and more natural to go back to the super-project from which the submodule was open. Now it just moves to the one on the left.
fields.summary: Closing a submodule tab does not go back to its super-project

fields.description:
I have a repo with many submodules
The git command sequence for checkout operation *is missing* a fundamental step.
1) git submodule deinit .
2) git checkout ...
3) git submodule update --init --recursive
Essentially the (2) and (3) are covered, but (1) is missing at all

Copy/Paste from SourceTree 
"
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false *checkout* event-w-obj_ptr
Switched to branch 'event-w-obj_ptr'


git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false *submodule update --init --recursive*
Completed successfully.
"

Pretend you are on master with 3 submodules: alpha, beta, gamma
Now checkout a commit that does not contain beta and gamma (could be a previous step in project development)
The result of not running (1) is that the 2 directories with beta and gamma are left on the file-system causing confusion!

This behaviour applies on branch switching too.

I'm not 100% sure 'cause I didn't test all possibilities, but I think you need to "git submodule deinit ." before any checkout operation.

This is a long standing issue affecting also previous versions
fields.summary: Missing git command when checking out projects with submodule

fields.description:
SourceTree works well until changes are pulled from the BitBucket repo. If no changes are available, this issue does not occur. I've not noticed this issue occur before pulling.

Once changes have been pulled, most actions involving commits yield a similar error to the following: ERROR [2016-03-02 09:31:56,725] [48] [SourceTree.Diagnostics.FailureHandler] [HandleGeneralTaskFailure] - 'hg log' failed with code 255: abort: repository C:\Users\[me]\AppData\Local\Temp\ji5w3v3y.gv1 not found!
 (C:\[local\path\to\repo])

If it matters at all, the temp file name does change on each different occurrence of the bug, the last three have been
ji5w3v3y.gv1, d13e52hh.0w4, t10jgg3s.qgj
fields.summary: hg log error messages showing after pulling new commits

fields.description:
Crash when attempting to commit a single change on one of my repos.
Happens when I re-launch and attempt it too.
Closing the repo and re-opening does not get around it.

I guess the experiment is over, and back to tortoisehg for now (and the constant wrestling with ShellIconOverlayIdentifiers) :/
fields.summary: SourceTree crash when attempting to commit.

fields.description:
When I commit my changes and click the files changed, "External Diff" option doesn't seem in right click menu on Log/History tab. I can use external diff with only "Ctrl + D" shortcut.

However before the commit, I see external diff option in right click menu.

This feature existed in previous versions.
fields.summary: "External Diff" option doesn't seem in right click menu on Log/History tab
Client software doesn't see last check-ins on origin/master!

fields.description:
If I add some file name with japanese character to git working directory, and open source tree which already has that git repository, then sourcetree crashes right after opening. I suspect that this is due to Japanese file name, because when I change the file name to english characters, the crash did not occur.
File name - コードレビュー観点.xls

Error log message - 
ERROR [2016-03-02 13:31:34,495] [1] [SourceTree.AppRoot] [HandleCrash] - Fatal error
System.Collections.Generic.KeyNotFoundException: The given key was not present in the dictionary.

fields.summary: Crash due to Japanese file name in "File Status" list

fields.description:
You can actually execute a checkout on the expandable category "Branches" in the side menu just like any branches, either by double-clicking or with a Right-click. This result obviously in an error:
"
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false checkout Branches
error: pathspec 'Branches' did not match any file(s) known to git.

Completed with errors, see above.
"
This is not major issue but I have a tendency to trigger it regularly under normal use.
fields.summary: Ability to checkout the "Branches" category

fields.description:
I use the split staging view (fixed, not fluid which I know is gone).
In previous versions I'm pretty sure I could select multiple files in the unstaged area (Shift-click or Ctrl-click to highlight the desired files), then click and drag those to the staged area.
This no longer works. I can select multiple files fine, but when I then click to drag it just alters the selection again rather than initiating a drag.
When you want to commit a sub-set of your modified files, the only option now is to stage them one by one. This gets tedious if there are many. Alternatively, staging all modified then un-staging the ones you don't want is a bit risky (and doesn't always help).
I skipped a few versions so I'm not sure exactly when this changed.
fields.summary: Drag of one or mulitple files from unstaged to staged is broken

fields.description:
SourceTree doesn't show untracked files. I can see this untracked files executing "git status" in the console, but I can't see it in SourceTree.
I add 2 screenshots to see my output.
fields.summary: SourceTree doesn't show the untracked files

fields.description:
*Scenario*
# Clone a repo
# checkout a feature/bugfix branch
# right click on the master branch and select "Pull origin/master into current branch"


*Issus*
The "Remote branch to pull should by default be "master". But it is being defaulted to the current branch.
fields.summary: Pull from master into current branch is not defaulting the dropdown to master

fields.description: Select a dropdown where file display options are listed like Flat List (Single Column). There is no more option for a Tree view. Options dialog has a new checkbox to show the Tree View option but it has no effect.
fields.summary: Tree view in file status is no longer available

fields.description: Go to "Clone / New" > Browse Hosted Projects. Look at the infinite loading animation. The repositories are loaded correctly this is just a UI issue.
fields.summary: Infinite loading cicle in Hosted Repositories" popup

fields.description: Tree view not viewed in Git Apps, I am unable to find folder wise. But old version is coming.
fields.summary: Tree View not viewed

fields.description:
Attempting to open or create a repository fails with errors if neither system nor embedded git are installed.
Instead of some cryptic messages (file not found, error code -1 etc) a message should be generated on program start that no git version could be found and what to do about it.
This would be especially helpful for git/sourcetree beginners.
fields.summary: Program should check if git is available

fields.description:
Clicked search.
Typed file name.
Changed search type to file changes.
Began scrolling through staged files while searching.
Froze during scroll
fields.summary: Crash/freeze on local file search

fields.description: If a diff has a line that extends beyond the UI, thus requiring a horizontal scroll bar, the UI overlaps the final line of the diff (see attachment).
fields.summary: Horizontal scroll bars in diff view overlaps final line

fields.description:
New installation on laptop win7-64 / current.
On pressing button to get a command line crash occurs.
Logfile attached
fields.summary: Crash on button "Command Line"

fields.description: In Source Tree it would be nice if space could be used to select / deselect file changes in the stages / unstaged lists. I think the previous version allowed this rather than having to click on the checkboxes.
fields.summary: Staging View - Space to check

fields.description:
The latest version of Source Tree for Windows doesn't seem to allow you to select a protocol preference for hosted accounts. (I.e. Selecting SSH as the preference for a GitHub account) Previously this worked but in the latest version the setting reverts back to HTTPS.

When viewing an account created and set to use SSH on a previous version, it shows as HTTPS in the hosted accounts list but when selecting edit on that account it correctly shows SSH.
fields.summary: Hosted Accounts List - Protocol Selection

fields.description: I right clicked on a committed file and selected "Open Current Version". I was then shown a dialog box that said source tree had crashed.
fields.summary: Crash when clicking "Open Current Version"

fields.description:
- open hg repo
- pull changes
- pull again

expected: no changes
actual: last diff
fields.summary: Pull with no changes shows the diff from last commit

fields.description:
After I actively use several hg repos, I get hg log error.

Often it occurs after commits, pushes and log views but I'm not sure about the case.
My usage scenario:
- open 2-3 repos
- view log, diffs, refresh and compare changes
- make changes, compare again, commit
- view log
- push
- view log 

I don't close tabs with active repos, having 2-3 permanently open.
I have about 4 open tabs and about 20 bookmarked hg+git repos.
Very annoying thing, only restarting SourceTree helps once it has occurred, as every click on log message brings up this error.

If you have logging options, please let me know, I'll enable it and attach logs.
fields.summary: hg log error occurs after active using

fields.description:
When a diff line requires a horizontal scrollbar, the scrollbar sits on top of the actual lines, rather than underneath it.

 !image-2016-03-01-11-39-12-475.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Scrollbar on diff sits on tops of diff content

fields.description:
If you (accidentally) select a line in the diff view, the button changes from 'Stage hunk' to 'Stage lines'

In 1.7.0.32509, you were able to cancel the selection and return the button to 'hunk' by clicking anywhere outside of the edit area, for example on the line with the file name or somewhere next to the buttons. In 1.8.2.3 the only way to cancel the selection is by selecting a different file and then returning to the original file.
fields.summary: Unstage hunk not possible after selecting a line

fields.description: If I try to copy value from the diff view, there is a crash and app exits
fields.summary: app crashes when copying line from a diff view

fields.description: In the diff view, you used to be able to use shift+click to select a block of lines (1.7.0.32509). This is not possible anymore. I can only use ctrl+click to select individual lines or drag an area of lines. For longer blocks of lines that is not very convenient
fields.summary: Unable to use shift+click to select multiple lines in diff

fields.description: When you unstage lines or hunks, the view moves to the 'unstaged' version of the file. This is a pretty annoying break of workflow. In 1.7.0.32509 you would remain at the staged file to continue checking the diff and possibly unstaging other parts.
fields.summary: Unstaging lines / hunks moves focus to 'unstaged'

fields.description:
I have updated from 1.7.0.32509 to 1.8.2.3 and I cannot adjust the order of tabs anymore by dragging them to the position I want. 

As a workaround, I am closing tabs and reopening the repositories in the order I want.
fields.summary: Unable to move tabs

fields.description:
There is a buttons "Open 'Before'" and "open 'After'" in the Log/History tab. 
When I try to open a file without registered Windows handler (.res in my case) SourceTree fall.
fields.summary: SourceTree died when I open file without registered windows handler.

fields.description:
In both the "File status" and "Log / History" view I'm not able to resize the width of the diff view.

In "Log / History" this only applies when viewing diff of "Uncommitted changes". Previous commits remember my set width just fine.
fields.summary: Unable to resize width of diff view

fields.description:
When viewing commit diff's for files with a lot of lines (+10000) then horizontal scrollbars appear.

See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Scrollbars in line numbers

fields.description: Trying to type commit message after first 2 characters source tree unexpected crashed.
fields.summary: Source crash on entering commit message

fields.summary: Application crash when starting Terminal in Menu

fields.description:
# updated to sourcetree 1.8.2.3
# right clicked file modified as part of any commit
# context menu did not contain anything resembling "launch external diff tool"

I couldn't find any evidence in release notes on this being a feature therefore I consider it a bug, having a major influence on my productivity.
fields.summary: External diff context menu is gone

fields.description: In older versions I could selected unstaged files and press space bar to stage selected files. Now this doesn't work any longer, and I need to select each file one-by-one.
fields.summary: Select multiple files with spacebar
First-Run-Wizard failed on cloning bitbucket hg repository

fields.description: When in the staging area, selecting multiple files and hitting the space key on your keyboard used to mark all the files currently highlighted. This is broken in the current version. I need this every day and I suspect that many more do out there. Please fix A.S.A.P!
fields.summary: Space does not work in staging area

fields.description: Crash when commit message contain "\". Commit, pull or push called crash when form with message refreshing
fields.summary: Crash when commit message contain "\"

fields.description: Source tree UI colors are not attractive. Cant able to see the difference between the Folders and Menu icons. Will be better when we have a better choice.
fields.summary: Colors are not adherent

fields.description:
Latest update have problem with Thai font.
V.17 We can read Thai font in file on Source Tree.
But today i'm update v1.8.2.3. I can't read Thai font in my file on Source Tree.
Please check and fix .
Thank you.

going back to the previous ST version. This is my third bug I logged in the last 15 minutes.

workaround: select another file and then select the file

1. stage file
2. clicking on it in the staged pane shows changes in the diff pane on the right hand side
3. staging another file blanks the diff pane even though the first file is still selected

workaround:
select the second file followed by the first file.

fields.description:
See attachments in order: *Step1* and then *Step2*

When on a local branch (in my case a release candidate) I need to pull several remote branches in. When I right-click on a remote branch and select "Pull origin/<some branch> into current branch", the dialog that pops up is defaulting the remote branch dropdown to the branch I am on and not the remote branch I had selected. 

This causes me to have to click the dropdown and find the remote branch I had originally clicked on when the dropdown should be the remote branch I had right-clicked.
fields.summary: Pulling a remote branch into a local branch is defaulting to wrong dropdown selection.

fields.description:
I opened SourceTree this morning and the application informed me that there was a newer version ready to be installed.  I went ahead with the upgrade but when the SourceTree was launched after the upgrade I got the following:
 !image-2016-02-29-12-55-08-817.png|thumbnail! 

I closed the SourceTree and opened it again with the same results.  I can't use the app.

Walter von Westphalen
Senior Build/Release Engineer
Transcend Insights

Attached is the bug log.

fields.description:
We use Jira and this gives us Issue IDs which include an aphbetical part and a numeric part

but the branch listing is sort ordered on alphabetical basis so that '10' will come after '1' but before '2' (through to '9')

 !image-2016-02-29-17-29-27-035.png|thumbnail! 

It would be much, much better if this was alpha-numerically sorted
fields.summary: make branch listing alpha-numeric

fields.description: The centered blocks are really distracting and don't add anything. At least provide an option to always use the whole width of the diff view.
fields.summary: Diff view should always fill the whole width

fields.description:
Just updated and noticed the Treeview Navigion is gone!. Checked the release notes and it seems the decision was made to do away with them. This the main reason I love SourceTree and been a faithful user since that feature got rolled out. 

Please put it back or at least make it an option that can be turned on and if that is not possible make previous versions of SourceTree with Treeview downloadable. Thank you for your time.
fields.summary: Put back the Treeview Navigation

fields.description:
Source trees stalls when picking different commit in log/history after I installed 1.8.2.2 and 1.8.2.3.  Every now and again, I have 1 commit that can cause the stall.  I can't tell there's a different between that commit and other commit.  it seems like 1 out 5 commit, I have one that has the problem. Once it stalls, the spinning wheel goes crazy and I can hear the CPU running hard.  My commits are small.

Any work around solution?
Thanks
fields.summary: source tree stalls when going from one commit to another

fields.description:
Actual behavior:
When creating a pull request from SourceTree on a repository hosted on Bitbucket Server, my web browser opens at the following url:

{{http://[hostname]:7999//projects/[project_tag]/repos/[repo_name]pull-requests?create&sourceBranch=[branch_name]}}

And I get the following error message:

{{SSH-2.0-SSHD-CORE-0.14.1-ATLASSIAN-01
Unsupported protocol version: GET //projects/[project_tag]/repos/[repo_name]pull-requests?create&sourceBranch=[branch_name] HTTP/1.1}}

This happens whether I try to create the pull request by right-clicking on the branch and selecting "Create pull request..." or by pressing Alt+Shift+P and selecting the branch by hand.

Expected behavior:
Have the "Create pull request" form open in the web browser.

Workaround:
* Either change the port from 7999 to 7990 in the URL indicated below, or;
* Create the pull request manually by navigating the Bitbucket Server web interface

Additional info:
This used to work correctly with SSH authentication pre-1.8.0.
fields.summary: Can't create a pull request when using SSH credentials

fields.description:
One of our components began failing, and I suspect it might be a leap year issue.  In order to start with a clean state, I restarted the VM.  Then the next application I tried to restart was SourceTree.  That failed, causing me to submit this bug.

What are the chances that similar issues are affecting our Atlassian server(s) as well?
fields.summary: Crash upon restarting computer/SourceTree

fields.description: Ever since the new UI was released, every update or crash of the software requires me to re-input the passphrase for my key.
fields.summary: Since the new UI was released, every update requires re-inputting password

fields.description:
This would be especially useful with Git Flow. If you're working on a feature branch, and want to finish the feature and merge back to develop, there's a high chance that someone has made changes to the develop branch, which means your develop branch is out of date. To be able to finish the feature, you'd have to switch to develop, pull from the origin, switch back to the feature branch, and then then finish the feature.

It would be much better if you could just make your develop branch pull the latest updates without having to switch back and forth to it. Luckily, it's very trivial to do with git. Just run a fetch command!

{noformat}
> git fetch origin develop:develop
{noformat}

This would fetch the latest changes from origin's develop into your own.

Ideally, the git flow commands should do that automatically (or better yet - present a prompt for that), but I'd love it if I had a "Fetch from origin" option in the context menu of a branch as well!
fields.summary: Allow branch specific fetching / (pulling updates into a branch without switching to it)

fields.description:
If you have group of files that have changes, they would appear in the Commit dialogue under the "Unstaged Files" title, if you click on the button beside "Unstaged Files" so that you Stage the entire group of files, the pointer would turn into the Wait, and the source tree would just stall at this, till you click on the stage button of any of the individual files, at that time, the staging of the entire group would take effect.

We noticed this strange (new) behavior, along with another new behavior of showing a Dialog per each stage operation that would prompt to press "close". Which a behavior that did not exist before this last update we did (i.e. a window confirming each stage operation started to appear).

The problem can be easily replicated.
fields.summary: Sourcetree: Staging a group of changes Hang till you press stage on an individual change

fields.description:
When wanting to unstage a contiguous block of lines, it is not currently possible to click top, hold shift, click bottom, as is common in UX (for example the UI for staging files allows for click->shift+click selections).

However holding ctrl to add to the selection works, and if the user selects multiple lines via ctrl+click that are all part of the same contiguous block, it would be intuitive for that to work. However it seems that the individual clicks, despite being contiguous, are not registered as a single contiguous selection, and therefore the error occurs as can be seen in the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Non-contiguous selection error despite being contiguous

fields.description: When I commit, "Submodule check" shows up and lists "Submobules with uncommited changes", Hitting "Open..." next to such module ends with crash. Log attached.
fields.summary: Crash on submodule handling

fields.description: Line numbers in diff area are truncated and there is also a little (and unuseful) scrollbar under line numbers which is not even usable. See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Truncated line numbers in diff area

fields.description:
The diff area, once it has scrollbars and is scrolled away from top, retains that same position (row) accross different commits and different files (whenever they also have enough diff for scroll bars to be shown).

I would expect that scroll is reset with file/commit change.

Even if the scroll position is remembered for the same file accross commits, it should be made configurable via settings.
fields.summary: Diff area scroll not reset after file change

fields.description:
(This issue is related to SRCTREEWIN-4812)

A few weeks ago, I reported that I changed the font in Diff but it didn't work. 
しばらく前、Diffのフォントを変更しても有効にならない件を報告しました。

There is an announcement that this problem was fixed at 1.8.2.3, but it has not fixed actually.
1.8.2.3で解決したというアナウンスがありましたが、実のところ、直っておりません。

I have made this issue again because I guess that the coding staffs don't have knowledge about Asian Font enough, perhaps.
現象を見るに、「ひょっとして、担当者様において、アジア圏のフォントについてのご理解が十分ではないのでは？」と思い、再度issueを立ち上げました。

h3. Asian font system in Windows

*Refs: https://msdn.microsoft.com/ja-jp/library/cc389896.aspx

As everyone knows, Windows System has "Multilingual User Interface(MUI)" and when MUI detect a character, it uses "suitable" font.
周知の通り、Windowsは「多言語インターフェース(MUI)」を備えており、MUIが文字を検出したとき、「しかるべき」フォントを使用します。

But, MUI uses Chinese font "MingLiU" for Japanese characters (Microsoft may think MingLiU is pan-east-asian font…??)
ところが、MUIは中国語フォントである「MingLiU」を日本語文字のために使用するのです(MicrosoftはMingLiUを汎東アジアのフォントと考えているのかもしれません…？？)

I suppose that font selection of MS-Gothic at \[Diff\] dialog is not set correctly, so MUI uses MingLiU as surrogate font.
思うに、\[Diff\]ダイアログでのMS-Gothicのフォント選択情報がうまくセットされていないため、MUIが代理フォントとしてMingLiUを使ったのではないでしょうか。

h3. Why MIngLiU cannot substitute for MS-Gothic?

As attached image, there are many differences between MingLiU and MS-Gothic, actually.
添付画像の通り、MingLiUとMS-Gothicとの間には実際かなりの隔たりがあります。

For western people, both may be just alike. But this difference affects code readability for us asian people.
西欧圏の方々には、両者は同じように見えるかもしれませんが、我々アジア人にはコードの読みやすさに大きな影響を及ぼします。


That's all for the moment.
さしあたり、以上となります。

Thanks.
ご査収よろしくお願いいたします。
fields.summary: Japanese characters are displayed by "MingLiU" font in Diff

fields.description:
For the last few weeks the ability to Right-Click a branch and select PULL branch INTO CURRENT BRANCH pops up the pull request screen but with the wrong branch selected.  I.e. NOT the branch I just right-clicked on.  This used to work as desired.

Also, one of my remotes needs the 'refresh' button clicked before it will even show the remote branch that I just right-clicked on.
fields.summary: Right-click branch to pull into current branch defaults to wrong branch

fields.summary: Crashed after logging in with Google

fields.description:
regression bug,   before (1.8.0 or so) was able to highlight unstaged files and press space-bar to select for staging.

now can not use spacebar.  I don't know any other way of multi-selecting files to stage.

used git, don't know if has issue with hg.
fields.summary: regression: can not multi-select unstaged files in file-status window

fields.description:
When I keep SourceTree running for some time, it displays a dialog that takes over the focus and requires me to login to Atlasian account.

I don't have any Bitbucket or other account configured in SourceTree.

If I dismiss the dialog, after several minutes it appears again.
fields.summary: SourceTree keeps asking for a password
